clinical_study.brief_title: Duration and Adverse Events of Non-cuffed Catheter in Patients With Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Duration and Adverse Events of Non-cuffed Catheter in Patients With Hemodialysis : a Multicenter Prospective Cohort Study

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University
The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Dalian Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The duration and adverse events of non-cuffed catheter in patients with hemodialysis will be investigated by multicenter prospective cohort. Totally, 1,400 patients with chronic renal failure requiring hemodialysis will be enrolled. 900 patients will be given right internal jugular catheterization, and the other 500 patients unsuitable for right internal jugular catheterization will receive femoral catheterizations. Every patient will be followed-up for six months. During following-up period, the duration time and adverse events of non-cuffed catheter will be recorded in details, including inadequate hemodialysis blood flow, venous stenosis, venous thrombosis, infection, catheter thrombosis and so on. The central vein will be evaluated by CT Angiography to identify its stenosis at last visit after 6 months. This multicentre trial will provide evidence to develop guideline for duration time of using non-cuffed catheter.

primary_outcome.measure: Bloodstream infection due to central venous catheter
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed-up during non-cuffed catheter retention, an expected up to 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Central venous catheter exit site infection
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed-up during non-cuffed catheter retention, an expected up to 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Long term occurrence of venous stenosis
secondary_outcome.description: CT Angiography for punctured vein will be performed to identify vein stenosis in last visit after 6 months.
ECG will be performed in preoperative, postoperative, catheter removal and last visit after 6 months.
adverse event or serious adverse event

clinical_study.condition: Infection Due to Central Venous Catheter

arm_group.description: 900 patients will be received temporary central vena catheterization in right internal jugular vein with non-cuff GamCath® catheter.They will undergo AVF creation.

500 patients will be received temporary central vena catheterization in femoral vein with non-cuff GamCath® catheter, which are unsuitable for right internal jugular vein catheterization.They will undergo AVF creation.

intervention.description: Using non-cuff GamCath® catheter in patients with chronic renal failure requiring hemodialysis to building short-term vascular access in femoral vein.
500 patients will undergo AVF creation in either arm for femoral vein catheterization group.
Using non-cuff GamCath® catheter in patients with chronic renal failure requiring hemodialysis to building short-term vascular access in right internal jugular vein.
intervention.other_name: radiopaque catheter(11F) polyurethane with curved extension lines

intervention.description: 900 patients will undergo AVF creation in left arm for internal jugular vein catheterization group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic renal failure requiring hemodialysis.
- No medical history of central vena catheterization.
- Maintenance hemodialysis after central vena catheterization.
- Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Had been performed central venous puncture or catheterization before.
- Can not use heparin.
- Refused to sign the informed consent.
- Advanced cancer patients.
- With or will take arteriovenous fistula surgery in right arm.
- Other inappropriate situation

overall_official.affiliation: Division of Nephrology, Shanghai ChangZheng Hospital
